text: Dan goes on to talk about all the fricking boring campaigns that he works on, but I found this part to be incredibly enlightening and I assume this is not going to be in the final copy of the book.
It's boxed out for some reason, it doesn't really fit into the narrative.
"I had entered politics as a bleeding heart liberal and my high school.
One of the requirements for graduation was undertaking a month long senior project per project.
Some students wrote plays, others painted murals and conducted sophisticated science projects.
I wrote in defense of a thesis that argued for socialism as a better governmental system than capitalism" That's footnoted and the footnote at the end is incomplete.
"It just says, I was young, dumb, and blank."
